column5: Like most of us, I have collected a bunch of fishing stuff I don't ever use.  A lot of it has been dollar store discount stuff that will not see water if I keep it.  Is there anywhere I can donate this?  I remember seeing Bass Pro having a deal where you donate old reels for a rebate on a new reel, but I don't think that applied to things like lures, which is what I have the most of.
Send a PM to Mr. O'Banion.  He has contacts with kids' groups that organize derbies for the little ones.
Try calling your local Big Brothers & Sisters group.
Isn't there a program called tackle share?
Rick is the answer he will be able to guide you to the correct place.  Art
If not, i think the provincial parks will take them for there fishing share program, I know they lend out rods and tackle

big brothers/sisters is a clear choice tackle share programme is alive and well local OMNR office OFAH--Mark Cousins--Urban Fishing- National Fishing Week  Walter Oster--www.sportshows.ca--Take a Kid Fishing- all welcomed recipients  Take a Kid Fishin  ID1
